market_summary: Tech selloff: SPY -1.78% today to 681.27, Nasdaq -2.04% to 600.64, Technology ETF (XLK) -2.64% to 139.21. Markets down ~2% from Feb highs amid Fed policy uncertainty and rotation to value
Semiconductor weakness: NVDA -1.63% to 186.94, AMD -3.57% to 205.94, AVGO -3.34% to 331.17. AI stocks face margin pressure and memory shortage concerns. Chip sector down ~6% month-to-date
Strong divergence: Energy +7.8% MTD (XLE 53.98), Gold +5.7% (GLD 451.39), Banks mixed (JPM -2.51%, GS -4.03%). Bitcoin -16% month-to-date to $65.8k amid risk-off. Defensive rotation in play

thesis: Best-in-class semiconductor fundamentals: 59.5% gross margin, 45.7% net margin, 28.1 P/E vs 71.7 for AVGO. ROE quality metrics unavailable but margins signal pricing power
Secular AI tailwind + defensive positioning: Up 14.3% YTD vs NVDA flat, AVGO -6.4%, AMD -15.2%. Leading-edge 3nm capacity growth insulates from commodity chip weakness
Strong momentum + value: Trading at 28.1 P/E with 13.6% EPS growth (0.24 PEG ratio), 9.6% FCF yield. Q3 revenue +6.0% YoY, EPS +13.6%, maintains pricing discipline in downturn
risks: Geopolitical Taiwan exposure intensifies if US-China tensions escalate; single-point-of-failure for global chip supply chain
Inventory correction risk: 3.4x inventory turnover suggests 106-day inventory vs peer median ~90 days; demand slowdown could compress margins
Valuation re-rating: 28.1 P/E vs historical 15-20x; if AI capex pauses or hyperscaler spending moderates, multiple compression to 20x implies 28% downside
falsifiable_checks: Q4 2025 (Jan 2026) revenue guidance >$25B (implies >10% YoY growth) and gross margin >58%; miss signals demand weakness
Stock breaks below $340 (200-day MA ~$355) or P/E compresses below 22x; triggers mean reversion risk
trade_of_the_day.why_now: TSM offers superior quality (60% gross margin) at reasonable valuation (28 P/E, 0.24 PEG) during tech sector dislocation. While peers face margin pressure (NVDA -7.5% MTD, AMD -17.8%), TSM is up 8.3% MTD on defensive positioning. 6-18 month catalyst: AI infrastructure buildout favors leading-edge capacity (TSM 3nm monopoly), Apple/NVDA refresh cycles in H2 2026, and potential geopolitical premium if Taiwan tensions ease post-US election cycle. Current selloff provides entry at 2024 valuation despite 2025 earnings upgrade cycle.

constraints_check.notes: Max position: TSM/AVGO/JPM 15% each (< 40% limit). Max sector: Technology 30% (TSM+AVGO), Financials 27% (JPM+GS) both < 80%. Crypto: BTC-USD 9% < 10% limit. 8 holdings across 5 sectors meets diversification requirements.
